comments:
This may be related to bug #115821, but I'm not sure. In that bug we are seeing
an intermittent NPE getting EMF resources during an auto build job. We tried
more workarounds in our code so that we would not access any artifact edits
while a build was running by joining the auto build job before making any WTP calls:

    Platform.getJobManager().join(ResourcesPlugin.FAMILY_AUTO_BUILD, null);

When we did this, we no longer get the NPE in bug #115821, but now we are seeing
a different set of NPE's during classpath initialization. There is usually an
NPE in BasicNotifierImpl.eNotify, followed by many NPE's in EcoreUtil.getAdapter
whenever code tries to access the JDT type system. It looks like the JDT is
trying to initialize, and part of that is initializing the JST webapp container,
which calls through to EMF, where the NPE happens. The subsequent NPE's are both
from our code doing things like calling getCorrespondingResource() on an IType,
and from the JavaSearchEngine (not sure who is calling that).

At this point you get a dialog saying "Error initializing java tooling", with
the last NPE I pasted below in the log, and the workspace is in a very bad state.

As I said in bug #115821 we are still on 1.0 M8, in the process of adopting a
later build, but I wanted to bring these up because they are causing so many
problems.

Here are the NPE's, the first one, and then a few samples of the subsequent ones:

Failure processing

I should add that this, like most of the other EMF related NPE's we're seeing,
is intermittent. It definitely happens more often if our views are active when
the workspace starts up (probably because more things are asking for information
from the webapp and from the JDT all at the same time). But I haven't found a
set of steps to repro them 100% of the time; and I have seen them happen when
our views are not active at startup.

to ensure the java container will be initialized after the build, but won't
deadlock, I created a job with the same scheduling rule as the java build.

Please reopen if these exceptions are seen in M9

This bug went away for a while (post-M9), but a similar one started happening after we adopted 1.0RC5. I have seen a few NPE's, and an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds, in EMF, during the JDT's classpath initialization. I'm not 100% sure it's the same issue but I think it probably is. I will try to gather some more info, but for now here's the exception I have seen several times:
